llm.feedback: The draft is on‑target for the 3–6‑month S&P 500 focus but needs tightening to meet Argos standards. 1) **Canonical mapping** – replace every reference to “S&P 500” with the canonical handle **spx**; add **fed_policy** for Fed actions, **us_cpi** and **us_pce** for inflation, and **ust10y** for the rate backdrop. 2) **Citations** – every factual claim (e.g., 40 % concentration, 2.7 % CPI, 2.9 % PCE, September payrolls, Fed’s September cut) must carry an inline (ID) citation; use FAN5RYW6T for concentration, the latest BLS releases for CPI/PCE, and the Fed’s September policy statement ID. 3) **Causal chain** – explicitly link the concentration shock → index multiplier effect → 5‑10 % move; link sticky inflation → Fed delay → higher term premium → valuation drag; link Q3 earnings → Fed policy → rate cut timing. 4) **Scenario structure** – state a **base case** (Fed cuts in September, CPI/PCE hold near 2.7/2.9 → spx +5 %); an **alt** (inflation decelerates → earlier cuts → spx +10 %); a **risk** (inflation >3 % → Fed holds → spx –5 % to –10 %). 5) **Magnitude & direction** – keep the 5‑10 % ranges but specify “up” or “down” and the 3–6‑month horizon. 6) **Catalysts & invalidations** – list watch signals: Q3 earnings of top‑10 constituents (spx), August CPI/PCE releases (us_cpi/us_pce), Fed September policy (fed_policy). 7) **Confidence** – add a brief confidence rating (e.g., “moderate”) and explain that the probability of a 5‑10 % pullback remains significant until the Fed’s stance and earnings clarity resolve. 8) **Remove any drift** – any mention of “Fed’s projected September rate cuts” without a citation or “sticky inflation” without data should be replaced or cited. Apply these edits to produce a concise, evidence‑based, action‑oriented scenario.
